commit_message:
Fixes an get_volume_stats reporting issue

This patch fixes a bug introduced in the last get_volume_stats
patch that caused the method to fail.  I Also added another set
of unit tests to catch any future issues related to get_volume_stats.

Fixes Bug: #1178418

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/28722

Change-Id: I5901057b2edb07f14706e23e81e75aa7567a127a

commit_message:
Remove service.model_disconnected

It appears this code is never used anywhere and was the reason for a try
'except Exception' block in servicegroup.  This 'except Exception' block
may be hiding critical bugs.

Change-Id: Ie071b141867acd74f2a02a9616b0f9874c13434b
Related-Bug: #1221987

subject: Adding RBD data striping capabilities to OpenStack
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-19 20:41:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adding RBD data striping capabilities to OpenStack (python-cinderclient)

blueprint rbd-stripe-parameters

When creating an RBD volume, various command line options can be specified;

two of these relate to data striping and are stripe_count and stripe_unit.

stripe_count: specifies the number of objects to stripe over before looping back to the first object.
stripe_unit: specifies the stripe unit size in bytes

We modify python-cinderclient to pass the RBD stripe parameters from Horizon to Cinder

This modification to cinderclient/v1/volumes.py simply receives the stripe_count
and stripe_unit parameters from Horizon via the VolumeManager.create method
and allows them to be used by Cinder

This implementation requires:
Adding RBD data striping capabilities to OpenStack (Horizon)
Adding RBD data striping capabilities to OpenStack (Cinder)

Change-Id: I8d985fc8d498544a2cf275e0cff77488ca3788b9

commit_message:
Adding RBD data striping capabilities to OpenStack

The python-cinderclient implementation

When creating an RBD volume, various command line options can be specified;

two of these relate to data striping and are stripe_count and stripe_unit.

stripe_count: specifies the number of objects to stripe over before looping back to the first object.
stripe_unit: specifies the stripe unit size in bytes

We modify python-cinderclient to pass the RBD stripe parameters from Horizon to Cinder

This modification to cinderclient/{v1|v2}/volumes.py simply receives the stripe_count
and stripe_unit parameters from Horizon via the VolumeManager.create method
and allows them to be used by Cinder

This implementation requires:
Adding RBD data striping capabilities to OpenStack (Horizon)
Adding RBD data striping capabilities to OpenStack (Cinder)

blueprint rbd-stripe-parameters

Change-Id: I8d985fc8d498544a2cf275e0cff77488ca3788b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-30 05:16:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move obj datadir cleanup to background thread

Add a .background() method to thread pools.  It queues up code to be ran in a
thread, then forgets about it.

Then use the new method to run datadir cleanup asynchronously, since it isn't
necessary for correctness and it might perceptibly speed up DELETEs and PUTs
that overwrite.  It might also imperceptibly speed up other PUTs and POSTs.

I'm not sure this is a good idea, so feel free to criticize.

(Nobody liked the idea of moving all of finalize_put to the background.
Bunch of scaredy cats.  We have 3 servers, it'll work somewhere.)

Change-Id: I755c80b0ce303fb948234df643e4e3bd7c9aca9b

commit_message:
Move obj datadir cleanup to background thread

Add a .background() method to thread pools.  It queues up code to be ran in a
thread, then forgets about it.

Then use the new method to run datadir cleanup asynchronously, since it isn't
necessary for correctness and it might perceptibly speed up DELETEs and PUTs
that overwrite.  It might also imperceptibly speed up other PUTs and POSTs.

I'm not sure this is a good idea, so feel free to criticize.

(Nobody liked the idea of moving all of finalize_put to the background.
Bunch of scaredy cats.  We have 3 servers, it'll work somewhere.)

Change-Id: I755c80b0ce303fb948234df643e4e3bd7c9aca9b

subject: Fake true return value for git show --quiet
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-26 04:40:51.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': 'Fake true return value for git show --quiet

Upstream change [1] introduced --quiet to the git show command.
Unfortunately on older git's before [2], to quote the git change-log:

    ...allows us to catch the "--quiet" option which causes some of the
    log-related commands to misbehave as it would otherwise get passed on
    to the diff.

Misbehaviour includes returning 1 instead of 0, which breaks the
stack.sh run.  Thus we fake a return value to be maximally compatible

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48011/
[2] https://github.com/git/git/commit/1c40c36b9acbb55726ea0fcf98714a85e159e45f

Change-Id: I6f06899133ffe377b948a9a491b29c2a13bbd01a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fake true return value for git show --quiet

Upstream change [1] introduced --quiet to the git show command.
Unfortunately on older git's before [2], to quote the git change-log:

    ...allows us to catch the "--quiet" option which causes some of the
    log-related commands to misbehave as it would otherwise get passed on
    to the diff.

Misbehaviour includes returning 1 instead of 0, which breaks the
stack.sh run.  Thus we fake a return value to be maximally compatible

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48011/
[2] https://github.com/git/git/commit/1c40c36b9acbb55726ea0fcf98714a85e159e45f

Change-Id: I6f06899133ffe377b948a9a491b29c2a13bbd01a

commit_message:
Allow -P to be invoked multiple times

If --parameters is specified more than once it is assumed
that each one contains only one parameter key=value.

This means semicolons are ignored if there is more than one -P
specified.

This should be fully backwared compatible, a single -P will
be assumed to be semicolon delimited.

Change-Id: Ic202ff3e0596b786cd5b07c53509f97a95d41585
Closes-Bug: #1224825
Closes-Bug: #1229030

commit_message:
Add an option for always synchronizing status

This patch adds an option for always synchronizing operational status
on a show operation; regardless of the synchronization thread, when
this option is enabled, the resource status is always fetched from
the backend.

The patch also fixes an issue observed when running test_nvp_sync
alone.

Bug #1229149
Bug #1229243

Change-Id: Ifef52ac1c48e32f413d51fc04fd926073335665d

commit_message:
Ensure router exists when auto_schedule_routers

Currently, the auto_schedule_routers() accepts parameter router_ids,
which may contain invalid router ids, since we've already filtered
them via plugin.get_routers(), we can directly use that safe object.

Closes-Bug: #1217998
Closes-Bug: #1210877

Change-Id: I6196f16cca65fee4e848173d0a0a10fde967195d

When a flavor is deleted a new one may be created with the same name.

flavors should be returned regardless of their name or replacement

commit_message:
Ensure get_all_flavors returns deleted items

When a flavor is deleted a new one may be created with the same name.
However when calling flavors.get_all_flavors(inactive=True) only the
latest flavor with the same name is returned. When inactive=True all
flavors should be returned regardless of their name or replacement
state.

Change the key used in the returned dictionary from
flavors.get_all_flavors() to the flavorid rather than the name. This
allows multiple flavors with the same name to be returned.

Fixes bug 1215295
Change-Id: I1b0c93b3e12714a5c0798aa87c9e3fe9bc14519a

commit_message:
Sync rootwrap with code from oslo

The rootwrap module had been directly edited in commit 1d366293.
These are all minor changes bringing neutron up to commit c03f247

c03f247 Skip hidden files while traversion rootwrap filters
3f4d1d5 Fix os.getlogin() problem with no tty
fc04531 Send rootwrap exit error message to stderr
3663010 rootwrap: improve Python 3 compatibility
28395d9 Fixes files with wrong bitmode

Fixes bug #1229492

Change-Id: Ica406e021700578b27c3337498011059c3a78719

commit_message:
Enable tenant isolation to tempest for neutron

This commit re-enables tenant isolation in tempest for neutron. This
is a requirement for running tempest in parallel. This commit depends
on tempest change I7587c85017cca09f7a67eae0670f67b2bceacb60

Fixes bug 1216076

Change-Id: I63a30bacd48cecd110fb90e1fc718249c2b1904b

commit_message:
Do not translate HOT param constraints

Do not translate HOT parameter constraint definitions and have them processed
by default CFN-based code. Instead, do HOT parameter constraint validation in
HOTParamSchema class to handle HOT-specific constraint syntax appropriately.
This is more robust than trying to map the new HOT syntax to old CFN
constraint style.

This patch is cleanup and first in a row for fixing the use of HOT templates
as provider templates.

Partial-Bug: #1224111

Change-Id: Ia35f281f874b906aabeb684fd9caca03dd994b9c

commit_message:
Rename counter_name to meter_name in alarm

In the newest ceilometer alarm version counter_name property was renamed to
meter_name. Right now heat uses old ceilometer client which still support
counter_name but newest ceilometer backend does not.

Change-Id: Ie7876119dc9b2a80d862f10de5f7265ad2a059f0
Closes-Bug: #1222830

[{'created': '2013-09-20 23:04:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixing database instance launch workflow

Two fixes related to one broken workflow.

First, 1227918 is a lack of support for trove backends that don't
have volume support enabled. To fix this, the user can now enter
into 0 for the volume size to work around this.  This alters how
the value is passed troveclient. Working with trove team to get a
programmatic way to determine is volume support is enabled.

Second, 1228416 is broken javascript when trying to launch a
database instance due to a couple of factors. The template for the
help is mislinked to use the project/instance one. Two, the fields
in the flavor that trove returns are different than the fields that
nova returns for flavor. This causes an exception when trying to
generate the quota/usage graphs on the right hand side of the form.
Since the javascript is looking for hardcoded values, this is not a
trivial fix so the offensive code has been removed until it can be
revisited. Additionally, there is no guarantee that the nova backend
trove uses is the same as the one regular compute uses. Needs more
thought/work.

Combined bug fixes because they are closely related to the same
action.

Change-Id: Ia378896d1d52067ac136c55ece9b527f44dd646b
Closes-bug: #1227918
Closes-bug: #1228416

commit_message:
Fixing database instance launch workflow

Two fixes related to one broken workflow.

First, 1227918 is a lack of support for trove backends that don't
have volume support enabled. To fix this, the user can now enter
into 0 for the volume size to work around this.  This alters how
the value is passed troveclient. Working with trove team to get a
programmatic way to determine is volume support is enabled.

Second, 1228416 is broken javascript when trying to launch a
database instance due to a couple of factors. The template for the
help is mislinked to use the project/instance one. Two, the fields
in the flavor that trove returns are different than the fields that
nova returns for flavor. This causes an exception when trying to
generate the quota/usage graphs on the right hand side of the form.
Since the javascript is looking for hardcoded values, this is not a
trivial fix so the offensive code has been removed until it can be
revisited. Additionally, there is no guarantee that the nova backend
trove uses is the same as the one regular compute uses. Needs more
thought/work.

Combined bug fixes because they are closely related to the same
action.

Change-Id: Ia378896d1d52067ac136c55ece9b527f44dd646b
Closes-bug: #1227918
Closes-bug: #1228416

commit_message:
BIND9 Plugin Cleanup

General cleanup of the bind9 plugin. Adds rndc addzone/delzone
functionality, which speeds up the plugin by allowing for dynamic
syncing of zones. Removes management of central bind configuration
from designate copying bind's statement of zones over. Also
updates some documentation to reflect the change.

Change-Id: I474ac1c2f0f1b5d8027862ac372bad653cb5d7ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-25 12:36:57.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_members_resource.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v2/test_images.py', 'glance/api/v2/image_members.py'], 'message': 'Change response code for successful delete image member to 204.

The delete image member call currently returns 200 with no response
body.  According to the API contract, 200 means to expect a body.

Closes-Bug: #1229366
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change response code for successful delete image member to 204.

The delete image member call currently returns 200 with no response
body.  According to the API contract, 200 means to expect a body.
This patch changes the response code to 204.

Change-Id: Id48187b3c47e39075a352d3027dd3d3451d46905
Closes-Bug: #1229366

commit_message:
Deprecate sql_* for database_*

Upstream change d5ae9ea70ed878e08e1d195f34c1989ecdd0b74f deprecated
default sql_* options for a new [database] section.

This deprecates the sql_ options and moves the new options into
the [database] sub-section of the config file.  If sql_* values are
given, they should be used but give a deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I05db83ace63399c0b2ebd63f74f5dc76ff5d3e9a

subject: Do not set tenant description in cache
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-26 19:14:30.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone_tenant/keystone.rb'], 'message': "Do not set tenant description in cache

Prevously, after the full list of tenants
was retrieved to build the cache, an
extra call was made to tenant-get per tenant to
retrieve the tenant's description.

This extra call changed the cache creation
operation from O(1) to O(N).

This commit improves the query complexity to
0(1) by moving the description lookup from
part of self.instances to the description
getter method (essentailly making it lazy).

This will work different depending on if you
are interacting with the resource in query
vs. manage mode.

In query mode, self.instances will build
out the cache withouth the description initially.
Since description is a properly, it will invoke
the getter method.

In manage mode, the description getter will only be invoked
for cases where the description is managed.

Partial-Bug: 1224179
Change-Id: Id9268678e122ba3aa3e5b0bcfd77466071a4192d
(cherry picked from commit b48032a42fd2019d0d11e1dafa22fd8431b0c1c9)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not set tenant description in cache

Prevously, after the full list of tenants
was retrieved to build the cache, an
extra call was made to tenant-get per tenant to
retrieve the tenant's description.

This extra call changed the cache creation
operation from O(1) to O(N).

This commit improves the query complexity to
0(1) by moving the description lookup from
part of self.instances to the description
getter method (essentailly making it lazy).

This will work different depending on if you
are interacting with the resource in query
vs. manage mode.

In query mode, self.instances will build
out the cache withouth the description initially.
Since description is a properly, it will invoke
the getter method.

In manage mode, the description getter will only be invoked
for cases where the description is managed.

Partial-Bug: 1224179
Change-Id: Id9268678e122ba3aa3e5b0bcfd77466071a4192d
(cherry picked from commit b48032a42fd2019d0d11e1dafa22fd8431b0c1c9)

subject: Make tenant name lookup for keystone user lazy
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-26 19:07:29.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/keystone.rb'], 'message': 'Make tenant name lookup for keystone user lazy

Previously, when you managed a keystone user, Puppet
would start by loading all information available
about each user. Most of this information was loaded
with a single call to user-list, but the tenant name
required an additional two commands (one to get the
tenantId, and an additional one to get the tenant name)

This patch makes the tenant lookup lazy, meaning that
those additional calls will only be performed when
the tenant attribute is actually used. This will
cause a significant performance increase for the
case where only a large set of users exists, and
only a small fraction of them need to be managed.

Partial-Bug: 1224179
Change-Id: I7141d8e922005ecae33c2c596c9806a03fede53f
(cherry picked from commit c194f374e2c54d03f34f28f002e478b8556c94c3)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make tenant name lookup for keystone user lazy

Previously, when you managed a keystone user, Puppet
would start by loading all information available
about each user. Most of this information was loaded
with a single call to user-list, but the tenant name
required an additional two commands (one to get the
tenantId, and an additional one to get the tenant name)

This patch makes the tenant lookup lazy, meaning that
those additional calls will only be performed when
the tenant attribute is actually used. This will
cause a significant performance increase for the
case where only a large set of users exists, and
only a small fraction of them need to be managed.

Partial-Bug: 1224179
Change-Id: I7141d8e922005ecae33c2c596c9806a03fede53f
(cherry picked from commit c194f374e2c54d03f34f28f002e478b8556c94c3)

subject: Do not set tenant description in cache

[{'created': '2013-09-21 07:30:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Do not set tenant description in cache

Prevously, after the full list of tenants
was retrieved to build the cache, and
extra call was made to tenant-get per tenant to
retrieve the tenant's description.

This essentially changes the cache creation
operation from O(1) to O(N) which is quite
a bit complexity given that the only result
is that you can see the description when
you run puppet resource keystone_teant.

This commit performs the optimization of removing
the extra tenant-get calls per tenant.

Instead, the description value is returned from
the description method which means it is only
called for managed tenants and not for all.

Change-Id: Id9268678e122ba3aa3e5b0bcfd77466071a4192d

commit_message:
Do not set tenant description in cache

Prevously, after the full list of tenants
was retrieved to build the cache, an
extra call was made to tenant-get per tenant to
retrieve the tenant's description.

This extra call changed the cache creation
operation from O(1) to O(N).

This commit improves the query complexity to
0(1) by moving the description lookup from
part of self.instances to the description
getter method (essentailly making it lazy).

This will work different depending on if you
are interacting with the resource in query
vs. manage mode.

In query mode, self.instances will build
out the cache withouth the description initially.
Since description is a properly, it will invoke
the getter method.

In manage mode, the description getter will only be invoked
for cases where the description is managed.

Partial-Bug: 1224179
Change-Id: Id9268678e122ba3aa3e5b0bcfd77466071a4192d

commit_message:
fix tee errors

Do not specify /dev/fd3 directly, use >&3 instead. This change enables
to use stack.sh as an upstart script, and with VERBOSE=False, it will
print the expected messages.

Fixes bug 1230342

Change-Id: I6e3a81fd435e8c46d553bfdee08f8bf42d0f4387

commit_message:
Bug#1192017-Added user quota info for Compute.

Added procedures for managing user quota info in Compute.
Updated the procedure for setting default quotas (to match the
manpage;'default' moved to end of command). Updated displayed tables,
and updated the listing of quota name/descriptions to match. Also
updated the title of the networking quotas page to be consistent with
other sections.
Updated dashboard page: added note about tenant user updates, combined
compute and block storage tables, removed floating and fixed ip descriptions
(were removed from dashboard listing), fixed procedures to match
Havana 3 changes.

Closes-Bug: #1192017

Change-Id: I059b1bbd6792be2fadfb28f49c2b2b3ec89e1d28

subject: Allow enabling Neutron orchestrated PXE.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-26 10:37:37.000000000', 'files': ['elements/nova/os-apply-config/etc/nova/nova.conf'], 'message': "Allow enabling Neutron orchestrated PXE.

This is off by default for compatibility with older Neutron's, but we
need it to get rid of file injection. As we want to support Havana
too, we probably need to be able to run both with and without this, so
making it an option seems reasonable.

Change-Id: If29d1e38930975b763bb9d10b37fb3ae040da96d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow enabling Neutron orchestrated PXE.

This is off by default for compatibility with older Neutron's, but we
need it to get rid of file injection. As we want to support Havana
too, we probably need to be able to run both with and without this, so
making it an option seems reasonable.

Change-Id: If29d1e38930975b763bb9d10b37fb3ae040da96d

integers as values.

commit_message:
Add config option to limit max stacks per tenant

Tenants will not be able to create more than max_stacks_per_tenant top
level stacks. This should prevent any one tenant from being able to
exhaust a Heat engine's resources.

Fixes bug #1221849

Change-Id: I29be4ecf5d5b9eb44d7ecc01907d08f30ac27990

Allow keystone to run from apache

Provide a template for running keystone as a mod_wsgi process and enable
it from configuration.

Based on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36474/
Also-by: zhang-hare <zhuadl@cn.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint devstack-setup-apache-keystone

Change-Id: Icc9d7ddfa4a488c08816ff4ae0b53c0134a1016b

commit_message:
Sync config group case with upstream.

Neutron now uses lower case for most config file groupings.

This change syncs with upstream so that the correct config
file case is used for the various OVS and linuxbridge components.

Change-Id: I1a471505b48161b9ee6bbe2a28db82c96a8c2598

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-08 18:53:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Handling network resources in tenant isolation

Functionality is added to create and delete isolated network, subnet and router
when isolated credentials are created and deleted for a primary, admin or alt
tenant.

When a set of isolated credentials are created, the tenant gets also a private
network, subnet and router. The router connects the tenat's network to the
public network designated by public_network_id in etc/tempest.conf

Change-Id: I7587c85017cca09f7a67eae0670f67b2bceacb60
Fixes: bug #1216076
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-09-08 21:28:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Handling network resources in tenant isolation

Functionality is added to create and delete isolated network, subnet and router
when isolated credentials are created and deleted for a primary, admin or alt

commit_message:
Handling network resources in tenant isolation

Functionality is added to create and delete isolated network, subnet and router
when isolated credentials are created and deleted for a primary, admin or alt
tenant.

When a set of isolated credentials are created, the tenant gets also a private
network, subnet and router. The router connects the tenat's network to the
public network designated by public_network_id in etc/tempest.conf

Change-Id: I7587c85017cca09f7a67eae0670f67b2bceacb60
Fixes: bug #1216076

commit_message:
Handled ajax request crash after session timeout

process_response refers request.horizon in case of ajax
request, but this attribute was not set on session timeout.
redirection to previous page was not sent.

IMPORTANT NOTE:
After a session timeout, when logging back in the requested modal dialogue
is displayed in a static view page.

Change-Id: I793b1c0a4c51107d263de0fe144dca26f5216d7a
Closes-Bug: #1214812

commit_message:
perf(mongodb): Combine project and queue message fields

This patch merges the message and queue collections' project name and
queue name fields into a single 'p_q' field, named to denote the
compound nature of the scoped queue name string.

This should reduce index complexity, making for faster inserts and
finds. This hypothesis obviously needs to be verified during the
review process for this patch.

Change-Id: I3da09806ad50c2d79f1f0c03bee68f1cc4ee787d
Implements: blueprint api-perf-tuning

subject: fix(mongodb): Marker generation creates a bottleneck under heavy load
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6427, 'name': 'Kurt Griffiths', 'email': 'kurt.griffiths@rackspace.com', 'username': 'kgriffs'}, {'_account_id': 6943, 'name': 'Zhihao Yuan', 'email': 'zhihao.yuan@rackspace.com', 'username': 'zyuan'}, {'_account_id': 6944, 'name': 'Allele Dev', 'email': 'cpp.cabrera@gmail.com', 'username': 'cpp-cabrera'}, {'_account_id': 8832, 'name': 'Mike Panetta', 'email': 'panetta.mike@gmail.com', 'username': 'mpanetta'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-18 22:44:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "fix(mongodb): Marker generation creates a bottleneck under heavy load

This patch changes markers so that they are generated using a per-queue
side counter. A heuristic is used to mitigate a race condition. Due to the
new semantics, partial inserts are no longer possible due to collisions,
which ended up simplifying the retry logic for posting messages.

As a consequence of this patch, the last message posted no longer needs
to remain in the queue indefinitely, rendering marconi-gc unnecessary,
and so it has been removed.

Also, since the mongod GC worker runs once a minute, the queries no longer
filter out expired-but-not-yet-gc'd messages; on average, a message may
live more than 30 seconds passed it's expected lifetime, but I do not
think that this will harm or complicate any application building on top of
Marconi, practically speaking. That being said, it is worth calling out
in documentation.

Closes-Bug: #1218602
Change-Id: I34e24e7dd7c4e017c84eb5929ce37ad4c9e5266a

filter out expired-but-not-yet-gc'd messages; on average, a message may
live more than 30 seconds passed it's expected lifetime, but I do not
think that this will harm or complicate any application building on top of
Marconi, practically speaking. That being said, it is worth calling out
in documentation.

Closes-Bug: #1218602

commit_message:
fix(mongodb): Marker generation creates a bottleneck under heavy load

This patch changes markers so that they are generated using a per-queue
side counter. A heuristic is used to mitigate a race condition. Due to the
new semantics, partial inserts are no longer possible due to collisions,
which ended up simplifying the retry logic for posting messages.

As a consequence of this patch, the last message posted no longer needs
to remain in the queue indefinitely, rendering marconi-gc unnecessary,
and so it has been removed.

Also, since the mongod GC worker runs once a minute, the queries no longer
filter out expired-but-not-yet-gc'd messages; on average, a message may
live more than 30 seconds passed it's expected lifetime, but I do not
think that this will harm or complicate any application building on top of
Marconi, practically speaking. That being said, it is worth calling out
in documentation.

Closes-Bug: #1218602
Change-Id: I34e24e7dd7c4e017c84eb5929ce37ad4c9e5266a

commit_message:
Fix "personality" parameter for binary contents

We can specify the decoded binary contents as the "personality"
parameter of "Create a server" API since the following commit:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20977/

So "text only" of contents is not necessary now.

Change-Id: Ib4d67b77529b00eb3f2bc4d0d036f1efbaf78b00

commit_message:
Remove _get_compute_info from filter_scheduler.py

After patch I6de33ada6dc377e20f8df07da92244f2c150b9fe and
Ie6f104368140b69a60e124ea96ef6bf7715fe34e, in filter_scheduler.py,
_get_compute_info has no use and no one is calling it, so we
can remove it directly.

Fix bug 1228475

Change-Id: Ia85068e402b6f0b2a9ed2a809d1c1dc63e0f3041

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 10:31:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VMware: ensure that the vnc_password does not to be configured

When the vnc_password was not configured in the 'vmware' section
the user was unable to access the VNC console.

Fixes bug: 1215352

Change-Id: I728861b8965ee3d3b8444a0440ddd0a8e5bb9021
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-22 14:00:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VMware: enable VNC access

When the vnc_password was not configured in the 'vmware' section
the user was unable to access the VNC console.

Fixes bug: 1215352

Change-Id: I728861b8965ee3d3b8444a0440ddd0a8e5bb9021
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-08-23 18:34:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VMware: enable VNC access without user having to enter password

When the vnc_password was not configured in the 'vmware' section
the user was unable to access the VNC console. The user would be
requested to enter a password but all attempts would fail.

The 'nvc_password' was added as a workaround to the problem above.

The fix ensures that the VMware driver behaves like all of the other
virt drivers when it comes to the VNC access, that is, the user will
not have to enter a password.

The password support will be deprecated and removed in the next
version.

Fixes bug: 1215352

Change-Id: I728861b8965ee3d3b8444a0440ddd0a8e5bb9021

The 'vnc_password' was added as a workaround to the problem above.

commit_message:
VMware: enable VNC access without user having to enter password

When the vnc_password was not configured in the 'vmware' section
the user was unable to access the VNC console. The user would be
requested to enter a password but all attempts would fail.

The 'vnc_password' was added as a workaround to the problem above.

The fix ensures that the VMware driver behaves like all of the other
virt drivers when it comes to the VNC access, that is, the user will
not have to enter a password.

The password support will be deprecated and removed in the next
version.

Fixes bug: 1215352

Change-Id: I728861b8965ee3d3b8444a0440ddd0a8e5bb9021

commit_message:
Add host os type for connector

Host os type is needed for some cinder storage drivers,
so nova should send this msg to cinder when attaching
volume to instance.
This patch make cinder identify:
Linux, Windows, XenServer and Vmware ESX

fixes bug 1224578
Change-Id: Ib21f7fa6ca082a465a69bfc0f62db51ee5aadad8

commit_message:
Ensure nullable=False for netid in packetfilters table

From the initial commit of NEC plugin, network_id of packetfilters
table is nullable=False, but in folsom_initial db migration script
nullable is set to True. This commit ensure nullable=False for
network_id in packetfilters table in any migration revision.

Change-Id: I2f1ebc16b57d8d6548255079c66d326d97fda5b6
Closes-Bug: #1229508

commit_message:
Remove CinderVolume id attribute

Using the id attribute can result in problems when validating a
template, as the resource_id is empty at that point, so we remove it to
prevent issues, as people ought to use Ref anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1230140
Change-Id: I16778d8036e7e2ccacf93caa4581ae0b0368b7c2

commit_message:
api ec2token: allow auth_uri conf to be set via keystone_authtoken

We already require the keystone_authtoken heat.conf section for the
auth_token middleware, and heat_keystoneclient.py.  So this patch
allows us to reuse the auth_uri specified in that section instead
of requiring a duplicate auth_uri to be specified in [ec2authtoken]

Change-Id: Ic5efafb7743aeddca990a4c560b423293108e1e0
Closes-Bug: #1229674

commit_message:
Update sample config generator script

This patch reverts 13d80020. The help message should be added
in oslo-incubator since generate_sample.sh is synced from there also.

Resolves bug #1204204

9f2b93b Sample config file generator clean up
33f9f78 Replaces relative path to absolute path in conf file generator
c97e17b Refactors if statement in config generator
8b11fda Provide useful defaults for config generator
4c02e0a Unset OS_xx variable before generate configuration

Change-Id: I96fcb39c0c620c147fea5c96416e506a758619ce

commit_message:
Force textmode consoles on baremetal

Physical hardware often has console interception hardware for OOB
monitoring/management. Prevent the kernel from switching into a
graphical console mode so the hardware can do its job.

Change-Id: I3a5b17ab194238ada34fee1c834de22fbdcd7430
Related-Bug: #1178112

commit_message:
fix: age presented as negative

Adds unit tests to verify that the bug never appears again. The unit
test is effective for storage backends that use timeutils to measure
the age of a message.

Bug manifests itself in both claims and messages.

Change-Id: I7fec4533236df5b232c0500835ac8e1d9d261d09
Closes-Bug: 1229358

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Change-Id: I2641c847403f61c5da8a8be0c8804c7c23a043ed

commit_message:
Change hard coded numbers to constants in security group tests

Security groups tests in Neutron contain a lot of hard coded HTTP return codes
and protocol numbers. These should be changed to use constants.

Change-Id: Ibecff3821c54f12848a05648f35381a0c73a0896
Fixes: Bug 1218928

subject: Fix subparsers add_parser() regression
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-25 19:20:29.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/config/cfg.py', 'tests/test_cfg.py'], 'message': 'Fix subparsers add_parser() regression

With SubCommandOpt, the handler() callback gets invoked with a
subparsers object which has a add_parser() method. The arguments to
this method match the arguments to the ArgumentParser constructor and
the arguments are passed to the class for our ArgumentParser instance.

However, we added a ArgumentParser subclass (_CachedArgumentParser) so
that we could sort the output of --help ... but the subclass doesn't
support all the arguments of the parent class.

glance-control is the only known example of a SubCommandOpt user which
passes unusual arguments to subparsers.add_parser(). It uses the parent
arg and blows up at startup with:

   File "./bin/glance-control", line 276, in add_command_parsers
     parser = subparsers.add_parser(server, parents=[cmd_parser])
   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/argparse.py", line 1064, in add_parser
     parser = self._parser_class(**kwargs)
 TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'parents'

It appears we broke glance-control back in June (commit 2951391), but
nobody noticed it until 1.2.0 was released and broke stable/grizzly
because we stopped using glance-control in the Havana glance unit tests
before this regression.

Closes-Bug: #1230416
Change-Id: I8d1b52e5390295726eb49af32eb7cab14c29592c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix subparsers add_parser() regression

With SubCommandOpt, the handler() callback gets invoked with a
subparsers object which has a add_parser() method. The arguments to
this method match the arguments to the ArgumentParser constructor and
the arguments are passed to the class for our ArgumentParser instance.

However, we added a ArgumentParser subclass (_CachedArgumentParser) so
that we could sort the output of --help ... but the subclass doesn't
support all the arguments of the parent class.

glance-control is the only known example of a SubCommandOpt user which
passes unusual arguments to subparsers.add_parser(). It uses the parent
arg and blows up at startup with:

   File "./bin/glance-control", line 276, in add_command_parsers
     parser = subparsers.add_parser(server, parents=[cmd_parser])
   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/argparse.py", line 1064, in add_parser
     parser = self._parser_class(**kwargs)
 TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'parents'

It appears we broke glance-control back in June (commit 2951391), but
nobody noticed it until 1.2.0 was released and broke stable/grizzly
because we stopped using glance-control in the Havana glance unit tests
before this regression.

Closes-Bug: #1230416
Change-Id: I8d1b52e5390295726eb49af32eb7cab14c29592c

commit_message:
add server resizing tests

add a few negative tests for server resizing

commit_message:
Fix problem with never stopping stress tests

This fix will fix the issue for never stopping stress test in
the nightly build jobs. It changes three problems related to this:

 - An exception in tearDown() will not cause a endless loop
 - Hanging processes will be killed with -9 after a while
 - tox job will stop on first error

Fixes-bug: 1230357
Change-Id: I3a0160295d98fdc7f8ffce64cc4a08c5c8ae654a

commit_message:
Default tenant id for quota_defaults.

For now manila quota_defaults can't be called without
explisit specificaton of tenant id. To fix this issue
shell py was modified with changes for
do_quota_defaults that implemets default value for
tenant id.

Change-Id: Ic44929f7941d1fb8c6626295853f56f8a561215b

commit_message:
Fix VCDriver to pick the datastore that has capacity

Changed to remove the hardcoding of selecting the first
datastore, instead the instance disk requirement is
calculated and the appropriate datastore is selected.

fix bug #1171930

Change-Id: I7857557d02cb56c45d52c6fc4bd956fc9180e836

commit_message:
tests: import pipeline config

This is a problem when running only one database test, as the pipeline
code might not be imported before, and overriding the option might not
work.

Change-Id: I0a0ba3b66419f45c2cc0a12d798b49a70a97673e

commit_message:
Remove DHCP_DRIVER from the seed boot call.

The seed doesn't need variation at this point, and config.json is
painful to edit. Rather than adding more sed debt, I think we can
avoid parameterising the seed for boot-technology for now, and just
migrate it entirely once the neutron native PXE is stable.
Pure Havana can support Neutron native PXE - it just won't be able
to support no-file-injection etc.

Change-Id: I92d203c5e496ca5d688243c50dbc140f8cc238a4

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 7368, 'name': 'Thomas Maddox', 'email': 'me@thomasem.net', 'username': 'thomasm'}, {'_account_id': 7680, 'name': 'Alex Gaynor', 'email': 'alex.gaynor@gmail.com', 'username': 'alex_gaynor'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-25 12:16:15.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Revert "Update Ceilometer alembic requirement to 0.6.0 version"

This reverts commit 0b3819b4a58dde35f8446ac3f76ecf8aa04c25ef.

This change was originally motivated entirely by usage of the new 'type_'
kwarg in calls to op.drop_constraint() from two ceilometer migration scripts,
even though the old 'type' form was retained for backward compatability:

  https://alembic.readthedocs.org/en/latest/ops.html

  "Changed in version 0.5.0: The type parameter is now named type_.
  The old name type will remain for backwards compatibility."

To avoid needlessly imposing the alembic 6.0 on distros for which this
version is not yet packaged, I propose to revert these migrations to use
the older form in ceilometer:

  https://review.openstack.org/48069

The global requirement may be similiarly reverted.

Change-Id: I71d5ca9aaf4789817ca2e0cf3f90a6ef8b63acd1
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Update Ceilometer alembic requirement to 0.6.0 version"

This reverts commit 0b3819b4a58dde35f8446ac3f76ecf8aa04c25ef.

This change was originally motivated entirely by usage of the new 'type_'
kwarg in calls to op.drop_constraint() from two ceilometer migration scripts,
even though the old 'type' form was retained for backward compatability:

  https://alembic.readthedocs.org/en/latest/ops.html

  "Changed in version 0.5.0: The type parameter is now named type_.
  The old name type will remain for backwards compatibility."

To avoid needlessly imposing the alembic 6.0 on distros for which this
version is not yet packaged, I propose to revert these migrations to use
the older form in ceilometer:

  https://review.openstack.org/48069

The global requirement may be similiarly reverted.

Change-Id: I71d5ca9aaf4789817ca2e0cf3f90a6ef8b63acd1

commit_message:
Log object lazy-loads

This is a trivial change that will be extremely helpful in tracking
down spurious lazy-loads and performance issues in the field. Simply
log to DEBUG any time we do a lazy-load of something. In practice,
this should be relatively rare.

Change-Id: I5e7bc058ba5ad17536a361367a0def5c4953643e

commit_message:
attach/detach_volume() take instance as a parameter

Previously the methods take instance['name'] as a parameter.
With this change, ComputeDriver can lookup informations about
the instance from hypervisor (in bare-metal driver, it is a local DB)
by any other attributes of the instance.

blueprint general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework

Change-Id: Ibd0567f34ed5053909ce1a408f9cbf87516ba597

commit_message:
Add hosts to pcloud.

Adding a new api to provision a reserved host to a plcoud.
A reserved host is one that  belongs to an aggregate named
"pcloud:reserve". Work in progress.

Partially implements blueprint: whole-host-allocation

Change-Id: I08230a2aaa3ba01465abe4e2a6624f2abd0ad7e9

commit_message:
Let apache module manage Listen directives

Without this change, the content of file /etc/apache2/ports.conf was flapping
between 'Listen 80' and 'Listen 0.0.0.0:80' at each puppet agent run.

(/Stage[main]/Apache/Concat[/etc/apache2/ports.conf]/File[/etc/apache2/ports.conf]/content) content changed '{md5}63840008875259fe2f00c2160146bde2' to '{md5}ac3b658e433eba85f350d4068b0ef826'
(/Stage[main]/Horizon/File_line[httpd_listen_on_bind_address_80]/ensure) created

Change-Id: I259cc013c14376a119f18eb1c0df7f35ad3a7cf1

commit_message:
Implement pagination support in driver backends

This patch builds on the support for filtering in the driver
backends to also provide pagination.  For drivers that are unable
to paginate, this will still be done at the controller level.

If the caller does not request pagination (by omitting 'page' from
the query string), then no pagination is attempted and the collection
results will be unchanged.

Limitations:

- LDAP pagination is not yet supported in the driver, and is currently
  still handled at the controller level. This will be provded by a
  separate patch.

DocImpact

Implements bp pagination-backend-support

Change-Id: I129acf59f09ba08e6a551368d0b06803a90cb158

commit_message:
Allow to handle objects in different high-level directory

Replaced static DATADIR with dynamic headers thus proxy-server
could read/write different locations on disk.

Change-Id: I3d1822f3644d0e8ed3f5a06984738863cef4805b

subject: Use print() func instead of print operator
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-08 14:34:42.000000000', 'files': ['tools/xenserver/cleanup_sm_locks.py', 'tools/xenserver/populate_other_config.py', 'tools/config/analyze_opts.py', 'tools/db/schema_diff.py', 'plugins/xenserver/networking/etc/xensource/scripts/ovs_configure_base_flows.py', 'tools/lintstack.py', 'tools/xenserver/destroy_cached_images.py', 'tools/xenserver/stress_test.py', 'tools/install_venv.py', 'tools/xenserver/vdi_chain_cleanup.py', 'tools/xenserver/vm_vdi_cleaner.py', 'tools/regression_tester.py'], 'message': 'Use print() func instead of print operator

In python 3 print operator is not supported, so we should
use only print() functions.

In cases when we should change ouptut source or print multiple elements
(e.g. print >> sys.out, "something" or print 1,2,3)
We should use from __future__ import print_function

Aslo in this patch some usage of locals() is clean up.

Change-Id: I9e591debdde0492104651443cbbdd90189f4628e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use print() func instead of print operator

In python 3 print operator is not supported, so we should
use only print() functions.

In cases when we should change ouptut source or print multiple elements
(e.g. print >> sys.out, "something" or print 1,2,3)
We should use from __future__ import print_function

Aslo in this patch some usage of locals() is clean up.

Change-Id: I9e591debdde0492104651443cbbdd90189f4628e

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Explicitely convert objects to string

Otherwise, when using datetime objects, json validation
fails on the client.

Change-Id: I12b143901a160eb415eb7af490071419dfb72007

commit_message:
handle KeyError in api: GET 'os-hypervisors/detail'

* using dict.get('key', 'default') to handle it.
* also fix same issue in v3 api

Change-Id: Ic80a1e6d487e68ae7afbf28b126aab2b866a7ed7
Closes-Bug: #1221679

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-12 23:08:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Account ACLs

Add support for optional account ACLs:

The authorization API is extended to include:
req.acl - container acls (as before)
req.account_acl - account acls (new)

Here are the acls provided to the Authorization system:

GET/HEAD object provides:
- req.acl = container read_acl (reading)

PUT/POST/DELETE objects provides:
- req.acl = container write_acl (writing)

GET/HEAD container provides
- req.acl = account read_acl (listing)
- req.account_acl = account read_acl (reading)

PUT/POST/DELETE container provides
- req.account_acl = account write_acl (writing)

GET/HEAD account provides
- req.account_acl = account read_acl (listing)

As before, it is upto the authorization system to decide which acl
to use and how.

delay_denail was added to account GET/HEAD
delay_denail was added to container PUT/POST/DELETE

tests were added to ensure appropriate acls are sent

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/account-acls

Change-Id: I0c31049c0842945cfe9ed26b2f54a99ecbfa70b3

commit_message:
Account ACLs

Add support for optional account ACLs:

The authorization API is extended to include:
container acls (as before) and account acls (new)

tempauth was updated to demonstrate the change:
  account admins can use  X-Account-Read and X-Account-Write to set
  Accounts ACLs. In this way account admins can grant other users
  the ability to create/list/delete containers.

Documentation was updated to descibe the optional new support.

As before, it is upto the authorization system to decide which ACL
to use and how.

delay_denial was added to account GET/HEAD
delay_denial was added to container PUT/POST/DELETE

tests were added to ensure appropriate acls are sent

DocImpact

Blueprint: account-acls

Change-Id: I0c31049c0842945cfe9ed26b2f54a99ecbfa70b3

commit_message:
Add MVRP support to LinuxBridge plugin

Enabled in /etc/neutron/plugins/linuxbridge/linuxbridge_conf.ini:

    [agent]
    mvrp = True

LinuxBridge will issue commands to configure network interfaces with
MVRP enabled, like so:

    ip link add link eth1 name eth1.100 type vlan id 100 mvrp on

Requies linux >= 3.9.8, and iproute2.  See contrib/mvrp/README.rst for details.

Implements: blueprint mvrp-linuxbridge
Change-Id: Ib0efeafca53dc801187c0655aa03244a6e5949f7

commit_message:
Add support of setUp and tearDown for test scenarios

Scenarios are based on pytest.
We run specified tests M times using N pytests in N threads.
So we are not able to make setUp and tearDown for all pytests
only one time.

So we are adding 2 new decorators to be able to bind to any of
test scneario functions that will be called before and after test
scnearion.

blueprint test-engine-utils

Change-Id: I4a5d02f48b2d0d22fbaf2b04c9af353184046bcb

commit_message:
Fix problem specifying VMware network name in flat networking

In FlatNetworking mode, VMware driver uses flat_network_bridge
parameter to look for or create networks in the ESX host. Because
flat_network_bridge is used by Network Manager to create linux
bridge, the network name should be a valid bridge identifier.

The fix uses vmware.integration_bridge instead of flat_network_
bridge for the network_name.

Fixes: bug #1226425

Change-Id: I54373e00440e36fce920a1a5f613ff571a63ff91

commit_message:
Reworked cli and mcli to use argparse

THIS IS A WORK IN PROGRESS, but I invite comments.
- Optparse changed out in favor of argparse
- CliOptions removed; APIToken created to manipulate that
- Removed _require and params fields in anything descended from CommandsBase

- Tox tests not attempted, as coverage has been destroyed
- Small glitch when missing required args for an action are missing: usage is printed once before __doc__  and once after
- Verbose and Debug in _pretty_print to be revisited for empty and error cases, OK printed almost without fail

The goal here is to make it much easier to follow and maintain these commands, especially the authentication process.

Change-Id: I8b89cd066af3f96f9b2ece559ea97e05a54f578a

commit_message:
change git show to | head -1

git show uses default system pager, which for people that have
funky pagers, goes sideways. Pipe this through head -1 to ensure
we only get the single change line we care about.

Change-Id: Iff22612b555bf58fe12101701cfe593f37e8f8de

commit_message:
Add user to project if project ID is changed

When an user updates project ID, it is necessary to make sure
the new tenant is available.

Remove the member role from the old tenant.

Add the member role to the new tenant.

Fixes bug 1201251

Change-Id: Ic6704b4007d7981d73ab760c88eb5145c2b988c6

commit_message:
Change pyrax identity_type of Rackspace resources

The Rackspace resources utilize the pyrax library. As of v1.4.11 of
pyrax, the manner in which default region is determined changed, such
that the keystone identity_type returned 'RegionOne' as the default
region rather than one of the Rackspace regions. Changing the
identity_type to rackspace fixes this.

Closes-Bug: 1227387
Change-Id: I193be7d81e83a42e33a7598d665e9d1970f10e9b

commit_message:
Move tests/unit/storage/base under m/tests/storage

If we want third-party backends to inherit from these tests, we need to
ship them along with Marconi. This patch moves storage base tests under
marconi/tests/sotrage.

Implements blueprint refactor-system-tests

Change-Id: Ic7390ead37694bdac9eb341da6f239b8c1178e1e

commit_message:
proxy: adds oslo.cache, config support, & stevedore

This patch brings together oslo.cache, oslo.config, and stevedore to
provide pluggable, hierarchical catalogue caching for marconi proxy.

Here's the list of changes:
- add configuration/driver loading at the app level
- remove select from proxy storage driver - unnecessary intelligence
  at storage layer
- node.weighted_select -> partition.weighted_select (clearer name)
- forwarding logic further refactored, placed in own module
- caching logic placed in lookup module
- selector passed down at app level to handle round-robin state
  globally
    * open to becoming configurable
- adds several TODOs for a better proxy

Change-Id: I3bc568315e685486d63cdce3ec278c89e3f2b2bc
Implements: blueprint placement-service

commit_message:
Stop HTTPClient from calling self.auth_token()

self.auth_token is a string, not a method, and so it shouldn't be
invoked.

Change-Id: Iad5da176fd5c7ea05f16a29c83eb718fc900607c

commit_message:
Pass correct args to vol_rpc create_volume calls

In the chance and simple scheduler, create volume was originally using
snapshot_id and image_id for request_spec and filter_properties. This
corrects that by passing the correct arguments and keyword arguments to
create_volume.

Change-Id: Icbcfbfb28f36e1f75519bf5ad6fcbcc12a9b4ec1
Closes-Bug: #1212710

In 1.8.0 (Grizzly), your proxy logs would indicate which middleware

commit_message:
Fix internal swift.source tracking.

In 1.8.0 (Grizzly), your proxy logs would indicate which middleware
was responsible for an internal request, e.g. TU for tempurl or BD for
bulk delete. At some point, those all turned into GET_INFO, which does
not give you any idea which specific middleware was responsible, only
that it came from a get_account_info/get_container_info call.

This commit puts it back to how it was in 1.8.0. Also, the
new-since-1.8.0 function get_object_info() got swift_source plumbing
added to it, so source tracking for the quota middlewares'
get_object_info() calls will happen now too.

Note that due to the new-since-1.8.0 in-environment caching of
account/container info, you may not see as many lines in the proxy log
as you would with 1.8.0. This is because there are actually fewer
internal requests being made.

Change-Id: I2b2ff7823c612dc7ed7f268da979c4500bbbe911

commit_message:
Cache cleaner wrongly deletes cache for non invalid images

Based on current implement of method delete_stalled_files,
it's just deleting all the images located in /incomplete
instead of using the param 'older_than' to check if it
should be deleted. So this fix will use 'older_than' to
confirm brfore deleting.

Fixes bug 1228256

Change-Id: Ica27915f8b9b098ecae1e38c8e678d6acf4f2f76

subject: Don't insert "Any Availaibility Zone" on single-AZ configurations
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-24 20:52:22.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows/create_instance.py'], 'message': 'Don't insert "Any Availaibility Zone" on single-AZ configurations

In cases where there is one AZ configured, Horizon displays the
option "Any Availability Zone" as the default.  This is confusing,
since there is only one.

Since there is logic to handle the "zero AZs configured" case
already, this is in fact an off-by-one error.  Alter the logic to
also handle the "one AZ configured" case and leave the single valid
option selected.

Fixes bug: 1229935

Change-Id: I49319e9c309c1ed41fd55e9297b0b461d17c726d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't insert "Any Availaibility Zone" on single-AZ configurations

In cases where there is one AZ configured, Horizon displays the
option "Any Availability Zone" as the default.  This is confusing,
since there is only one.

Since there is logic to handle the "zero AZs configured" case
already, this is in fact an off-by-one error.  Alter the logic to
also handle the "one AZ configured" case and leave the single valid
option selected.

Fixes bug: 1229935

Change-Id: I49319e9c309c1ed41fd55e9297b0b461d17c726d

commit_message:
Adds setting for allocation rates

Nova Scheduler Filter restricts making virtual machines by physical
machine specs.(RAM)
In some cases someone hopes making many virtual machines unboundedly.
One way is setting allocation rates.

This patche provides way of setting it by use of localrc.

Change-Id: I8ec19803a8409317a9bc2c8964a0fa27aeabcac1

commit_message:
v3 API samples for servers

Adds the rest of API samples for the core servers plugin. This is separate
from the other servers api samples because the output is potentially
dependent on all the other extensions and I'm expecting lots of merge
issues.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-specification
Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: Iffc814f327b0047c3510bfe5b8bbcb9e0e4540db

subject: Determine security group API dynamically
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-23 05:00:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/neutron_tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/network_tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/network.py', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/neutron_data.py'], 'message': "Determine security group API dynamically

This commit removes enable_security_group from local_settings.py
and determines which security group API should be used (nova or
neutron).

Closes-Bug: #1227804

As described in bug 1203413, there is a case where Nova security group
with Neutron driver causes a problem. The type of 'name' attribute in
add_security_group_to_instance and remove_security_group_from_instance
depends on the backend, integer for nova security group driver and
UUID for quantum security group driver to make it work as expected.

enable_security_group config parameter produces a situation where
Nova security group with Neutron driver. We can avoid this situation
by removing this parameter when using Horizon.

Change-Id: I713c6ad166e142929f0a708e93a8fedb0de48640
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Determine security group API dynamically

This commit removes enable_security_group from local_settings.py
and determines which security group API should be used (nova or
neutron).

Closes-Bug: #1227804

As described in bug 1203413, there is a case where Nova security group
with Neutron driver causes a problem. The type of 'name' attribute in
add_security_group_to_instance and remove_security_group_from_instance
depends on the backend, integer for nova security group driver and
UUID for quantum security group driver to make it work as expected.

enable_security_group config parameter produces a situation where
Nova security group with Neutron driver. We can avoid this situation
by removing this parameter when using Horizon.

Change-Id: I713c6ad166e142929f0a708e93a8fedb0de48640

commit_message:
Remove colon in item names in LBaaS detail page

Also changes the followings for consistency with other pages:
- Replace "Tenant ID" with "Project ID"
- Show '-' when name or description is empty
- Apply yesno filter for True/False field
- Rearrange field order in pool and VIP details

Closes-Bug: #1230057

commit_message:
make _user_to_credentials() work with v2 users

The _user_to_credentials() method in policy.py expects users to be
v3-style.  Since v2 is still supported, make it stop exploding when
fed v2 users.

Fixes Bug: 1229980

Change-Id: Iddf56a48f684ce78bc69dd84fba39a3b3c1045ea

commit_message:
Pin hacking>=0.7.2,<0.8 in global-requirements

There have been several bugs reported in nova lately for flake8 errors
but they are only showing up if you run against the latest hacking
version. For those with a stale virtual environment or pip mirror, these
can sneak by due to the older version of hacking required in
global-requirements.

Closes-Bug: #1230277
Related-Bug: #1227655
Related-Bug: #1229753

Change-Id: Idf3da7d8982a08b69ae1f18e1d2565358f9ba075

commit_message:
Support glance client can get ipv6 image url correctly

This patch is for fix bug 1208784. In openstack ipv6 environment,
if the os image url is not provided, need use the provided host
to generate literal ipv6 image url.

Fixes bug 1208784

Change-Id: Icb71241a639db02d079348f086bd7bd5f0412609

subject: Fix json version of bootable check
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-23 22:30:19.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_get.py'], 'message': "Fix json version of bootable check

This is a follow up to change id:
  I8a4b1f4ce3a6a420e8152ea8c66a9b3fc127fe96

The initial change only addressed the xml aspect of the bug
and ignored the json tests.

This change updates the check to catch the same errors when
performing the json version of the checks.

Both of these patches are temporary and after the Cinder update
lands should be replaced with a proper/strictly enforced check of
'true' and 'false' values in the volume['bootable'] field.

Change-Id: Iffe5d380410f5c698018a5c3106c99af05f0b80d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix json version of bootable check

This is a follow up to change id:
  I8a4b1f4ce3a6a420e8152ea8c66a9b3fc127fe96

The initial change only addressed the xml aspect of the bug
and ignored the json tests.

This change updates the check to catch the same errors when
performing the json version of the checks.

Both of these patches are temporary and after the Cinder update
lands should be replaced with a proper/strictly enforced check of
'true' and 'false' values in the volume['bootable'] field.

Change-Id: Iffe5d380410f5c698018a5c3106c99af05f0b80d

subject: Update man pages
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-25 02:14:20.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/man/keystone-manage.rst', 'doc/source/man/keystone-all.rst'], 'message': "Update man pages

Updates the man pages based on the latest oslo.config and
Keystone code. oslo.config is version 1.2.0.

To generate the man pages, ran

 tools/with_venv.sh bin/keystone-all -h

and copied the output to the man page. A couple of changes were
required because of the output formatting.
1) Escape * in *.config otherwise it's considered emphasis without
   end.
2) --log-file is split to separate lines which results in a space
   in the output, so put it back together.

commit_message:
Update man pages

Updates the man pages based on the latest oslo.config and
Keystone code. oslo.config is version 1.2.0.

To generate the man pages, ran

 tools/with_venv.sh bin/keystone-all -h

and copied the output to the man page. A couple of changes were
required because of the output formatting.
1) Escape * in *.config otherwise it's considered emphasis without
   end.
2) --log-file is split to separate lines which results in a space
   in the output, so put it back together.

Change-Id: Ic76b7eafd04551ec01a3c117b9d5a73471b1e4ce

commit_message:
Update OpenStack services to support qpidd element

Configuration files are changed so that qpid is used as the rpc_backend
instead of kombu (rabbitmq) if it is specified in the metadata.

Add qpid-python to Heat, Neutron, and Cinder requirements.txt file.
These elements install using venv and don't use the system installed
libraries. These changes can be removed if requirements.txt is changed
upstream. There are two bugs tracking these changes:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1225191
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1225232

Change-Id: I9bf6ab9d3bae668e592af65b5c8075a487e07261

commit_message:
Add setup-passwords script.

The script is run once from devtest and writes out a file
(tripleo-passwords by default) that you source into your shell
environment to set the password environment variables.  If you lose
your shell accidentally, you can source the file again later.

Change-Id: I6317d4d66a95e181d4b7e8893e6502cc07c62026

commit_message:
API GET to return only minimal data

Requests to list top-level resources like nodes, chassis or ports will
now return only a subset of it's attributes, a subresource called /detail
could be used to get the full details of the resource. This changes
is supposed to improve performance and UX, also, others OpenStack APIs
already do it the same way so it's also about being consistent between
other APIs.

Change-Id: Ida45febf60e44d50e506f3680ab371e1027010c4
Closes-Bug: #1227431

commit_message:
Fix port deletion in NEC Plugin

Cascade on delete from ports.id to packetfitlers.in_port is added
to ensure packet filter entries associated with a port.
Also joined query of packetfilter with port query is added
to avoid additional packetfilter query by port_id.

Fixes: bug #1212102

Change-Id: I8a67649f3361480eda6377b1d8a30bebd18aa714

subject: Correct deleted_at value in notification messages
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-20 12:22:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Correct deleted_at value in notification messages

The deleted_at value in notification messages is currently
set from the terminated_at value in the instance record.

A comment in the code says this is to avoid confusion between
terminated_at and deleted_at,  but swapping the names doesn't
seem to be a great way to address that.

In practice "terminated and not deleted" is a transient state
unless an error occurs, and the time gap is very short.  But
deleted_at is always set when the entry is deleted in the DB,
whereas terminated_at can be left unset in some error cases.

Rather than present terminated_at as the deleted_at value in
the message we include both and let the recipient decide which
they want to use.

Fixes bug: 1227080

Change-Id: Ic67f66b6c64be1a8f43f4fdd5b1fac25f1414247
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-09-20 13:41:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/notifications.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Correct deleted_at value in notification messages

The deleted_at value in notification messages is currently
set from the terminated_at value in the instance record.

A comment in the code says this is to avoid confusion between
terminated_at and deleted_at,  but swapping the names doesn't
seem to be a great way to address that.

In practice "terminated and not deleted" is a transient state
unless an error occurs, and the time gap is very short.  But
deleted_at is always set when the entry is deleted in the DB,
whereas terminated_at can be left unset in some error cases.

Rather than present terminated_at as the deleted_at value in
the message we include both and let the recipient decide which
they want to use.

Fixes bug: 1227080

Change-Id: Ic67f66b6c64be1a8f43f4fdd5b1fac25f1414247
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Correct deleted_at value in notification messages

The deleted_at value in notification messages is currently
set from the terminated_at value in the instance record.

A comment in the code says this is to avoid confusion between
terminated_at and deleted_at,  but swapping the names doesn't
seem to be a great way to address that.

In practice "terminated and not deleted" is a transient state
unless an error occurs, and the time gap is very short.  But
deleted_at is always set when the entry is deleted in the DB,
whereas terminated_at can be left unset in some error cases.

Rather than present terminated_at as the deleted_at value in
the message we include both and let the recipient decide which
they want to use.

Fixes bug: 1227080

Change-Id: Ic67f66b6c64be1a8f43f4fdd5b1fac25f1414247

commit_message:
Clean up automated changes to requirements

Some of us like to reuse sandboxes, and keep them up to date.  This
is very difficult to do if devstack leaves modifications to
requirements.txt files after a run, since 'git pull' may refuse to
overwrite those changes.

This modification has devstack undo the changes to the requirements
files, to leave the sandbox in a clean state again.

Change-Id: Ia2d928ade8141b59b56a2c4548d760bf6911a3e5

subject: Functional test suite for devtest.

[{'created': '2013-09-21 16:06:28.000000000', 'files': ['tests/base.py', 'tests/README.md', 'tests/test_overcloud.py', 'tests/test_seed.py', 'tests/test_undercloud.py'], 'message': "Functional test suite for devtest.

This commit adds a test suite that can be run against the OpenStack
environments that are set up by devtest.  There are tests for the
seed, undercloud, and overcloud.  The test suite could be run at the
end of a devtest run, or at various points along the process to test
progress (e.g., run tests in test_seed.py after setting up the seed).

The tests are useful to make sure that things were set up correctly
and how devtest expects.  Granted, if you get to the very end of
devtest, it's likely everything worked.  But, they also add value in
that they can be used to troubleshoot what went wrong if a devtest
step fails unexpectedly.  For example, a test that verified the nova
baremetal flavor was created as we expect, might uncover a bug if the
flavor wasn't set up correctly by Nova.

We could also have TOCI execute the tests at the end of a run.

For now, there are just a few tests to illustrate how this might work.
More tests could be added for things like:
 - verifying neutron was set up correctly
 - verifying nova was set up correctly (flavors, nodes created, etc)
 - shelling out to virsh to verify baremetal{0-2} were setup
 - basically, we could test anything that devtest does.

Change-Id: I71e0276146e5270556d1aeea457f77de31cc0c12
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Functional test suite for devtest.

This commit adds a test suite that can be run against the OpenStack
environments that are set up by devtest.  There are tests for the
seed, undercloud, and overcloud.  The test suite could be run at the
end of a devtest run, or at various points along the process to test
progress (e.g., run tests in test_seed.py after setting up the seed).

The tests are useful to make sure that things were set up correctly
and how devtest expects.  Granted, if you get to the very end of
devtest, it's likely everything worked.  But, they also add value in
that they can be used to troubleshoot what went wrong if a devtest
step fails unexpectedly.  For example, a test that verified the nova
baremetal flavor was created as we expect, might uncover a bug if the
flavor wasn't set up correctly by Nova.

We could also have TOCI execute the tests at the end of a run.

For now, there are just a few tests to illustrate how this might work.
More tests could be added for things like:
 - verifying neutron was set up correctly
 - verifying nova was set up correctly (flavors, nodes created, etc)
 - shelling out to virsh to verify baremetal{0-2} were setup
 - basically, we could test anything that devtest does.

Change-Id: I71e0276146e5270556d1aeea457f77de31cc0c12

commit_message:
Log message for image object not found in swift

The get method of the swift driver needs logging when the image
is not found in the container.
This change also adds the location of the image to the message.

Fixes bug 1227786

Change-Id: I33bd5ee5edf985211139d9d4519b494b2b19b5a9

subject: Add log_additional_locale config property for easy log translation
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 17:35:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/gettextutils.py', 'openstack/common/log.py', 'tests/unit/test_log.py'], 'message': "Add log_additional_locale config property for easy log translation

Just like it is possible to configure a log file by specifying the
log_file property in the {service}.conf file, allow the secondary locale
log to be configurable via a simple {service}.conf property.

This should allow setting up the secondary locale log relatively easy
without necessarily having to create and setup a logging.conf.

For example, if nova.conf has log-file = '/var/log/nova/api.log' and
log_additional_locale='zh', the following secondary log file will be
created:

    /var/log/nova/api.log
    |------------/zh
                 |--/api.log

Change-Id: I85b4645e18277f498f7b040b7acc6d91d55245ac
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add log_additional_locale config property for easy log translation

Just like it is possible to configure a log file by specifying the
log_file property in the {service}.conf file, allow the secondary locale
log to be configurable via a simple {service}.conf property.

This should allow setting up the secondary locale log relatively easy
without necessarily having to create and setup a logging.conf.

For example, if nova.conf has log-file = '/var/log/nova/api.log' and
log_additional_locale='zh', the following secondary log file will be
created:

    /var/log/nova/api.log
    |------------/zh
                 |--/api.log

Change-Id: I85b4645e18277f498f7b040b7acc6d91d55245ac

commit_message:
Rebuilding stopped instance should not set terminated_at

At the end of a rebuild action, nova checks the original vm_state
of the instance to see if it was stopped. If the instance was
originality stopped, nova will stop the newly rebuild instance.
Right before the stop, nova updates the instance and sets it's
terminated_at to utcnow(). Due to this, the periodic usage audit
does not send usage for the instance.

There's no reason for setting tereminated_at here, it should only
be set as part of instance deletion

Fixes bug: 1189554

Change-Id: I141aba1b4f3c15a4c17e1fc401ae9479acafb23f

commit_message:
Fixed issue with resource OS::Neutron::Port creation

Heat was not able to create resource OS::Neutron::Port
when ip_address attr was not specified in fixed_ips property.

From Neutron point of view, attribute ip_address of property fixed_ips is
not required and can be ommited. But when specified it is should be valid
ip address.

Bug #1224472

Change-Id: I39ba545762b96fb7267c91afa5c36bd7d16be6a6

commit_message:
Add keystone backend

This patch adds keystone support for the client. It is possible to
either provide os_auth + endpoint through the CLI or all other required
params to retrieve both or one of them.

Implements blueprint keystone-integration

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-19 08:17:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Authentication API + Keystone backend

The API still needs some refactor but, the idea is to have multiple
authentication drivers that can be used depending on how Marconi was
configured.

Some things that could be change are:

    * The `authenticate` method should be request-agnostic, instead, we
      could get a target instance back from it which will then be used
      to complete the request at a transport level.

    * Avoid patching the request instance, as per above point.

Target definition is still under discussion, which is why this patch is
being submitted as-is.

Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: I94e2c12cf0648be8557d8b2ddc43a7aa76ae313f

commit_message:
Authentication API + NoAuth backend

This patch adds a auth base class with a NoAuth backend, which is the
default auth method for Marconi.

Implements blueprint keystone-integration

Change-Id: I94e2c12cf0648be8557d8b2ddc43a7aa76ae313f

commit_message:
Added test to check list/show extensions-neutron

Added a test script 'test_extensions.py' to api/networks to verify
if list/show of extensions is successful in neutron. Also added
supporting methods 'list_extensions' and 'show_extension_details' in
network client for XML and JSON interfaces.

Implements blueprint: quantum-test-l2-abstraction

Change-Id: Ie939a3e1302060489b579baf2cd3f7023efbeb7d

subject: Incorrect error code impacted by debug level
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-23 02:34:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Incorrect error code impacted by debug level

Now there are something wrong with the WSME json code,
as a result, the HTTP return code will be wrong if the
Ceilometer debug level is set as False, which is impacting
almost all the exceptions defined in wsme.exc. But it
works fine with wsme.exc.ClientSideError, so using it
before the issue is fixed by WSME.

Fixes bug 1218760

commit_message:
Incorrect error code impacted by debug level

Now there are something wrong with the WSME json code,
as a result, the HTTP return code will be wrong if the
Ceilometer debug level is set as False, which is impacting
almost all the exceptions defined in wsme.exc. But it
works fine with wsme.exc.ClientSideError, so using it
before the issue is fixed by WSME.

Fixes bug 1218760

Change-Id: I842aad841bdd21c0c51f0ee0c1fc8b671fc7c85f

commit_message:
make git show not display a diff

if the top commit includes actual content, this was being displayed
in the devstack log, which was just confusing. --quiet suppresses
this.

subject: api ec2token: Clear failure when no auth_uri specified
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-24 14:40:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "api ec2token: Clear failure when no auth_uri specified

Currently if the CFN API is misconfigured, such that no auth_uri
is set in the config, we silently fail because we don't detect that
auth_uri==None in the code.  Instead catch this situation and assert
that the service is misconfigured via a 500 response.

Change-Id: I47a385aa6a34fe3133de00cf2b18fec6a4f6645a
Partial-Bug: #1229674
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-09-24 16:37:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "api ec2token: Clear failure when no auth_uri specified

Partial-Bug: #1229674
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-09-25 08:51:05.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_api_ec2token.py', 'heat/api/aws/ec2token.py'], 'message': "api ec2token: Clear failure when no auth_uri specified

Partial-Bug: #1229674
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
api ec2token: Clear failure when no auth_uri specified

Currently if the CFN API is misconfigured, such that no auth_uri
is set in the config, we silently fail because we don't detect that
auth_uri==None in the code.  Instead catch this situation and assert
that the service is misconfigured via a 500 response.

Change-Id: I47a385aa6a34fe3133de00cf2b18fec6a4f6645a
Partial-Bug: #1229674

commit_message:
Improve the CM shell client alarm visualisation

This change aim to get a better alarm representation in shell.

In alarm-list:
* it add a short sentence to describe the alarm rule
* it remove project_id/user_id because it always show the same id for
  all alarm for end-user

In alarm-show, it show alarm rule attributes as alarm properties instead
of a unparsable json in the rule property.

example of short sentence for column 'Alarm condition':
* combinated states (AND) of 8babd6a2-c457-42d0-9eb5-cdfb3cb50203,
  d0e11a94-8f59-48a9-8f6d-b0d68aaac8d0
* cpu_util >= 50.0 during 1 x 60s

Change-Id: If4df2dc08f9f4cb7796fd98308c7d62e311d1138

commit_message:
Comparing device name values instead of their reference

Although end users specified device name as `vda' but since `is' in
python is used to compare reference, bootable volume is not
detected. We should use `==' to compare values instead.

Fixes bug #1229610

Change-Id: I7f127dc489706482f6bb245372bfd8079b91c40f

[{'created': '2013-09-23 01:14:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Replace first_public_address/first_private_address

OS::Nova::Server attributes first_public_address and first_private_address
will not work with neutron, which allows any network name to be assigned
not just 'public' and 'private'.

This change replaces these attributes with a 'first_address'
attribute which uses the same nova_utils.server_to_ipaddress method
that AWS::EC2::Instance uses to populate all of its IP address
attributes.

This needs to be fixed before the Havana release to avoid these
broken attributes needing to be supported.

Change-Id: I0b4dc009d665e4d7b4cbc32d484a2efc6068320a

commit_message:
Replace first_public_address/first_private_address

OS::Nova::Server attributes first_public_address and first_private_address
will not work with neutron, which allows any network name to be assigned
not just 'public' and 'private'.

This change replaces these attributes with a 'first_address'
attribute which uses the same nova_utils.server_to_ipaddress method
that AWS::EC2::Instance uses to populate all of its IP address
attributes.

This needs to be fixed before the Havana release to avoid these
broken attributes needing to be supported.

Change-Id: I0b4dc009d665e4d7b4cbc32d484a2efc6068320a
Closes-Bug: #1228929
